intro: Notylia cordesii, commonly known as the golden trumpet. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae, characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are woody and branched. Notylia cordesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
